description: Two-sided marketplace connecting homeowners with local contractors using aerial imagery for accurate estimates. Aggressive marketing & engagement design with web + mobile apps.

userStories.title: Initialize Next.js project with Tailwind CSS
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a modern React framework with styling ready so I can build the marketing site and web app.
acceptanceCriteria: Next.js 14+ with App Router initialized
Tailwind CSS configured with custom colors (brand: blue-600, success: green-500, urgent: red-500)
TypeScript enabled
Basic folder structure: /app, /components, /lib, /types
Typecheck passes
Dev server runs successfully

userStories.title: Create aggressive marketing landing page
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to immediately understand the value proposition and be compelled to sign up.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section with bold headline: 'Get 5 Local Bids in 24 Hours' + CTA button
Dual-path CTAs: 'I Need Work Done' vs 'I'm a Contractor'
Social proof section: '10,000+ jobs completed' (with animated counter)
How It Works: 3-step visual process for each user type
Urgency banner: 'Limited spots for contractors in your area' (rotating)
Fully responsive design (mobile-first)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add trust signals and conversion elements
userStories.description: As a visitor, I need to trust the platform before signing up.
acceptanceCriteria: Testimonials carousel with photos and star ratings
Featured contractors section with profile pictures
Press logos (even if placeholder): 'As Seen In...'
Live activity feed: 'John in Brooklyn just posted a roofing job' (simulated initially)
Sticky bottom CTA bar on mobile: 'Get Started Free'
Exit-intent popup: 'Wait! Get $50 off your first job'
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Setup Supabase project and environment variables
userStories.description: As a developer, I need backend infrastructure configured so I can build auth and database features.
acceptanceCriteria: Supabase project created (or use existing)

@supabase/supabase-js installed

Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create database schema for users with roles
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to store user data with client vs trade roles.
acceptanceCriteria: Table: profiles (id, email, role: 'client' | 'trade', created_at)
Table: trade_profiles (user_id, business_name, services[], service_radius_miles, zip_code, rating, total_jobs)
RLS policies: users see only their own profile
Migration file created and applied
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Implement Supabase Auth with role selection
userStories.description: As a user, I want to sign up and choose if I'm a client or contractor.
acceptanceCriteria: Sign-up flow with email + password (or magic link)
Role selection step: 'I need work done' vs 'I'm a contractor'
Auto-create profile record with selected role
Login page with 'Remember me' checkbox
Session persistence across page reloads
Redirect to appropriate dashboard based on role

userStories.title: Create job posting schema

acceptanceCriteria: Table: jobs (id, client_id, title, description, address, lat, lng, service_type, status: 'open' | 'in_progress' | 'completed', budget_min, budget_max, created_at)

RLS policies: clients see their own jobs, trades see open jobs in their area
Indexes on lat/lng for geo queries
Migration applied

userStories.title: Build job posting form with aerial imagery
userStories.description: As a client, I want to post a job and see my property from above.
acceptanceCriteria: Multi-step form: 1) Job details, 2) View property, 3) Review

userStories.title: Implement geo-matching for local jobs
userStories.description: As a contractor, I want to see only jobs within my service area.
acceptanceCriteria: Postgres function: calculate_distance(lat1, lng1, lat2, lng2) using Haversine formula
API route: /api/jobs/nearby?user_id=X returns jobs within trade's radius
Filter by service_type matching trade's services
Sort by distance (closest first)
Typecheck passes
API returns correct data (test with sample records)
